: real or complex vector, matrix or multidimensionnal array.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: direct
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.P: x=fft(a,-1) or x=fft(a) gives a direct transform.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: single variate
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.P: If a is a vector a single variate direct FFT is computed that is:
x(k)=sum over m from 1 to n of a(m)*exp(-2i*pi*(m-1)*(k-1)/n)
for k varying from 1 to n (n=size of vector a).
(the -1 argument refers to the sign of the exponent..., NOT to "inverse"),

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: multivariate
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.P: If a is a matrix or or a multidimensionnal array a multivariate direct FFT is performed.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: inverse
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.P: a=fft(x,1) or a=ifft(x)performs the inverse transform normalized by 1/n.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: single variate
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.P: If a is a vector a single variate inverse FFT is computed

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: multivariate
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.P: If a is a matrix or or a multidimensionnal array a multivariate inverse FFT is performed.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: Long syntax for multidimensional FFT
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.P: x=fft(a,-1,dim,incr) allows to perform an multidimensional fft.
If a is a real or complex vector implicitly indexed by j1,j2,..,jp i.e. a(j1,j2,..,jp) where j1 lies in 1:dim(1), j2 in 1:dim(2),... one gets a p-variate FFT by calling p times fft as follows
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.VERBATIM: incrk=1; x=a; for k=1:p x=fft(x ,-1,dim(k),incrk) incrk=incrk*dim(k) end
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.P: where dimk is the dimension of the current variable w.r.t which one is integrating and incrk is the increment which separates two successive jk elements in a.
